intro: Galeomma stenolepis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved galeomma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided, pinnate leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Galeomma stenolepis is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
